description: From Middle English hechele, of West Germanic origin, related to the root of hook. Compare hackle.

entries.meaning: A comb used to separate flax fibers.
examples: One end of the bundle being hatchelled, it is turned round, and the other is treated in the same way; and the process is repeated on finer hatchels.

verbs.description: hatchel (third-person singular simple present hatchels, present participle hatchelling or hatcheling, simple past and past participle hatchelled or hatcheled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To separate (flax fibers) with a hatchel, or comb.
